string.text: Thompson M1A1

A simplified version of the iconic submachine gun, designed for mass production and military use during World War II. Featuring a straight blowback action and a box magazine, it retains the firepower of its predecessors while being more cost-effective and easier to manufacture. Its durability and stopping power made it a favored weapon among soldiers in frontline combat.

Thompson Model 1921

A high-quality, early variant of the famous Thompson submachine gun, known for its smooth operation, high rate of fire, and classic drum magazine. Originally intended for law enforcement and civilian markets, the "Chicago Typewriter" became infamous during the Prohibition era as a weapon of choice for gangsters and lawmen alike. Its finely machined components and distinct design make it a highly sought-after collector’s firearm.
